content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for the course 'Exploring Quantum Physics' on Coursera, offered by the University of Maryland, College Park. Identify the percentage (rounded) of 5-star ratings in the reviews.  Please interact with https://www.coursera.org/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current screen shows a Coursera promotional banner. To search for the course "Exploring Quantum Physics," I need to find the search bar or menu. I will scroll down to look for navigation or search options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.05
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section introduces Coursera's university and company partners along with some platform benefits. There is still no visible search bar or navigation menu. I need to scroll down further to locate the search functionality.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.05
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section features recommended courses and specializations but still does not provide a search bar or general navigation menu. To search for a specific course, I need access to the search functionality, so I should continue scrolling down.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search bar is now visible, allowing searches by keyword. I should enter "Exploring Quantum Physics" to look for the desired course.
Action: Type 2; Exploring Quantum Physics
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" offered by University of Maryland, College Park has been found. I need to click on the course to access its reviews and see the percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 10
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course search result is still visible and matches the requested course. The next step is to access detailed course information and reviews, likely by clicking on the course listing.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current screen is still on the search results, displaying the "Exploring Quantum Physics" course with its rating summary. I need to access the detailed course reviews to determine the percentage of 5-star ratings, which likely requires clicking on the course entry.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The interface still displays the search results for the course, and I am not yet on the dedicated course details/reviews page. To find the detailed percentage of 5-star ratings, I need to proceed by selecting the course listing.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot again shows the search results page and not the course's detail or reviews section. I need to view the detailed course information by clicking the course listing to check review statistics, specifically the percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The interface is still at the search results stage, and I have not yet accessed the course detail or review percentage data necessary to answer the task. To view more detailed information including ratings breakdown, I must click on the course listing.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot is still on the search result page. In order to see the 5-star rating breakdown, I need to access the course's detailed reviews or stats, which should be in the course detail page. This requires clicking on the "Exploring Quantum Physics" course item.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot remains on the search results page, showing the course summary but not the detailed review statistics needed to answer the question. I need to click on the course item to enter the detailed course page and access the exact percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The detailed information about the course ratings (including the percentage of 5-star reviews) is not visible yet, as we are still on the search results page. I need to click on the course card to view the course details and ratings breakdown.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" is visible in the search results, but we still need to access the individual course detail page to find the exact percentage of 5-star ratings in the reviews. Clicking on the course entry is the next logical step.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" is highlighted in the search results, but there is no detailed rating breakdown yet. I need to access the course detail page to find the percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" is shown in the results but the breakdown of ratings (including % of 5-star reviews) is not visible. To get this information, I'll need to open the course detail page by clicking on its listing.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course listing for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is visible, but the breakdown of reviews, especially the percentage of 5-star ratings, is not shown. I need to click the course entry to view more detailed information, specifically the reviews section.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
